definition: tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: This moves the carry into bit position of the accumulator.
sentences.chinese: 把進位移到累加器的位元。

sentences.english: Computational results can be extracted from an accumulator at any time.
sentences.chinese: 計算的結果可以在任何時候從累加器上取出。

sentences.english: The totalizer must be with reading by drums moving in front of an index.
sentences.chinese: 累加器必須帶有在目錄盤上滾動的讀數。

sentences.english: This pointer counatisn any balance accumulator to allow YTD limit.
sentences.chinese: 此指針包含任何餘額累加器從而允許年初至今限制。

sentences.english: Water meters should be with a totalizer mechanism completely waterproof.
sentences.chinese: 水錶應該帶有一個完全防水的累加器裝置。

sentences.english: JPN Branch to the address specified by the operand if the contents of the accumulator are negative.
sentences.chinese: 如果累加器內容是負數，分支到操作數指定的地址。
